title: Google DeepMind to Open Singapore AI Research Lab

content:
By Megan Cheah
SINGAPORE--Alphabet's Google DeepMind is opening a new artificial-intelligence research lab in Singapore, focusing on collaboration with governments, academic institutions and businesses across the Asia-Pacific.

title: SoftBank stock implies OpenAI is worth $750 bln
description: The ChatGPT developer is not yet listed. That makes the Japanese tech investor's 11% stake a rare public proxy for the artificial intelligence darling. Subtract its other holdings, and SoftBank shareholders appear to be valuing the startup at 50% above its most recent price tag.
content: SoftBank founder Masayoshi Son's characteristically bullish bet on OpenAI has paid off so far. The Japanese tech tycoon invested in the company at a $300 billion valuation in April, and recently acquired shares from employees at a $500 billion price ... [4982 chars]

title: Rise of the robots: the promise of physical AI
description: TOKYO, Japan — A pair of swivelling, human-like robotic arms, built for physical artificial intelligence research, mirror the motions of an operator in a VR headset twirling his hands like a magician.
content:
TOKYO, Japan — A pair of swivelling, human-like robotic arms, built for physical artificial intelligence research, mirror the motions of an operator in a VR headset twirling his hands like a magician.

title: Asian shares retreat in cautious trading ahead of Nvidia profit report
description: Asian shares have fallen in cautious trading after worries about Nvidia and the overall market frenzy over artificial intelligence technology sent Wall Street stocks lower
content:
TOKYO (AP) — Asian shares retreated in cautious trading Wednesday ahead of an earnings report from Nvidia that is seen as a bellwether for the recent craze for artificial intelligence technology.

title: Ghost-to-cat morphing scene in ‘Aakasha Ganga’ cost ₹12,000 per second, says Vinayan

title: UPDATE 1-Elon Musk, Jensen Huang to talk AI at US-Saudi investment forum
description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk and Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang will take part in a discussion on advances in artificial intelligence and technology at a U.S.-Saudi Arabia investment forum in Washington on Wednesday, according to a document seen by Reuters.
